metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0642 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.5.48 and earlier, 5.6.29 and earlier, and 5.7.11 and earlier allows local users to affect integrity and availability via vectors related to Federated.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.13-0ubuntu4').
